content:
Size Struct

In this Article

Implements a structure that is used to describe the Size of an object.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.SizeConverter))]
[System.Windows.Markup.ValueSerializer(typeof(System.Windows.Converters.SizeValueSerializer))]
public struct Size : IFormattable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • Size

Remarks

Size is particularly useful because it describes both the Height and Width of an object. Size is used extensively by the layout system to arrange and measure elements.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="width,height"/>

XAML Values

width
A value greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the Width of the Size structure.

height
A value greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the Height of the Size structure.

Constructors summary

Size(Double,Double)

Initializes a new instance of the Size structure and assigns it an initial width and height.

Properties summary

Empty

Gets a value that represents a static empty Size.
Height

Gets or sets the Height of this instance of Size.
IsEmpty

Gets a value that indicates whether this instance of Size is stem.Windows.Size.Empty*.
Width

Gets or sets the Width of this instance of Size.

Methods summary

Equals(Object)

Compares an object to an instance of Size for equality.
Equals(Size)

Compares a value to an instance of Size for equality.
Equals(Size,Size)

Compares two instances of Size for equality.
GetHashCode()

Gets the hash code for this instance of Size.
Parse(String)

Returns an instance of Size from a converted String.
ToString()

Returns a String that represents this Size object.
ToString(IFormatProvider)

Returns a String that represents this instance of Size.

Operators summary

op_Equality(Size,Size)

Compares two instances of Size for equality.
op_Explicit(Size)
op_Explicit(Size)
op_Inequality(Size,Size)

Compares two instances of Size for inequality.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IFormattable.ToString(String,IFormatProvider)

This type or member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Constructors

  • Size(Double,Double)

    Initializes a new instance of the Size structure and assigns it an initial width and height.

    public Size (double width, double height);

    Parameters

    • width
      Double

      The initial width of the instance of Size.

    • height
      Double

      The initial height of the instance of Size.

    Remarks

    The width and height cannot be negative.

Properties

  • Empty

    Gets a value that represents a static empty Size.

    public static System.Windows.Size Empty { get; }

    Property Value

    • Size

      An empty instance of Size.

    Remarks

    The Width and Height of the instance of Size are equal to negative-infinity when this property is invoked. This is the only situation where Size can be a negative number.

  • Height

    Gets or sets the Height of this instance of Size.

    public double Height { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The Height of this instance of Size. The default is 0. The value cannot be negative.

  • IsEmpty

    Gets a value that indicates whether this instance of Size is stem.Windows.Size.Empty*.

    public bool IsEmpty { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this instance of size is stem.Windows.Size.Empty*; otherwise false.

    Remarks

    Even if Size is 0, the instance of Size will still contain a 0 or 1, indicating a zero- or one-dimensional set of points. Therefore, do not use this property to check for a 0 area.

  • Width

    Gets or sets the Width of this instance of Size.

    public double Width { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The Width of this instance of Size. The default value is 0. The value cannot be negative.

Methods

  • Equals(Object)

    Compares an object to an instance of Size for equality.

    public override bool Equals (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      Object

      The Object to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the sizes are equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Double values can result in an error when operated upon. Values that are logically equal might fail to result in a value of true.

  • Equals(Size)

    Compares a value to an instance of Size for equality.

    public bool Equals (System.Windows.Size value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Size

      The size to compare to this current instance of Size.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the instances of Size are equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Double values can result in an error when operated upon. Values that are logically equal might fail to result in a value of true.

  • Equals(Size,Size)

    Compares two instances of Size for equality.

    public static bool Equals (System.Windows.Size size1, System.Windows.Size size2);

    Parameters

    • size1
      Size

      The first instance of Size to compare.

    • size2
      Size

      The second instance of Size to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the instances of Size are equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Double values can result in an error when operated upon. Values that are logically equal might fail to result in a value of true.

  • GetHashCode()

    Gets the hash code for this instance of Size.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      The hash code for this instance of Size.

  • Parse(String)

    Returns an instance of Size from a converted String.

    public static System.Windows.Size Parse (string source);

    Parameters

    • source
      String

      A String value to parse to a Size value.

    Returns

    • Size

      An instance of Size.

  • ToString()

    Returns a String that represents this Size object.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String that specifies the width followed by the height.

    Remarks

    If the Width property is set to 30 and the Height property is set to 40, the ToString method returns a string that says "30, 40".

  • ToString(IFormatProvider)

    Returns a String that represents this instance of Size.

    public string ToString (IFormatProvider provider);

    Parameters

    • provider
      IFormatProvider

      An object that provides a way to control formatting.

    Returns

    • String

      A String that represents this Size object.

Operators

  • op_Equality(Size,Size)

    Compares two instances of Size for equality.

    public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Size size1, System.Windows.Size size2);

    Parameters

    • size1
      Size

      The first instance of Size to compare.

    • size2
      Size

      The second instance of Size to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the two instances of Size are equal; otherwise false.

  • op_Explicit(Size)
    public static System.Windows.Point op_Explicit (System.Windows.Size size);

    Parameters

    • size
      Size

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Point

      To be added.

  • op_Explicit(Size)
    public static System.Windows.Vector op_Explicit (System.Windows.Size size);

    Parameters

    • size
      Size

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Vector

      To be added.

  • op_Inequality(Size,Size)

    Compares two instances of Size for inequality.

    public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.Size size1, System.Windows.Size size2);

    Parameters

    • size1
      Size

      The first instance of Size to compare.

    • size2
      Size

      The second instance of Size to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the instances of Size are not equal; otherwise false.

Explicit Interface Implementations

    This type or member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    Parameters

    • format
      String

      The format to use.

    • provider

      The provider to use to format the value.

    Returns

      The value of the current instance in the specified format.
